thread.title: Krauthammer: Philosophically, Today Was a Victory for Obama
thread.title_full: Krauthammer: Philosophically, Today Was a Victory for Obama

author: Josh Feldman
title: Krauthammer: Philosophically, Today Was a Victory for Obama
text:
Krauthammer: Philosophically, Today Was a Victory for Obama by Josh Feldman | 6:46   
On Fox’s Special Report tonight, Charles Krauthammer reacted to the American Health Care Act being pulled by saying that philosophically, former President Barack Obama scored a victory today. 
He said the country has changed in the years since Obamacare was passed into law and the terms of the debate––who’s going to lose health care and how many––show that there is now a “generalized expectation that there is an entitlement to universal health care.” 
Compared to that, Krauthammer added, “What did the Republicans have to offer?” 
He said aside from the “we made a promise” line from Paul Ryan and others, it wasn’t clear what the “essence of it” was. 
Next time they want to do this, Krauthammer concluded, Republicans should just pass a version with more items conservatives wanted and then leave it to Senate Democrats to reject it. 
Watch above, via Fox News. 
[ image via screengrab ]
